results.title: Eat to live
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
Food has alway’s been man’s first preoccupation. Today, while many people get too little of the foods necessary for good health, others of us are overweight through eating too much food that has little or no nutritional value

results.title: Eat the rich
results.creator_credit: Peter Richardson, Tim Van Rellim and Ironfist Pictures
results.brief_description: From the makers of the “Comic strip” and the “Young Ones”, this black and often tasteless comedy is certain to startle. Alex, a black waiter at a celebrated restaurant for the rich called “Bastards”, is sacked. Determined to wreak revenge, he organises a people’s take over and captures the restaurant. Renaming it “Eat the Rich”, Alex and his friends serve up their own special brand of millionaires mince. Not for the faint-hearted and with a heavy metal soundtrack by Motorhead.

results.title: Eat the peach
results.creator_credit: Peter Ormrod, John Kelleher and Strongbow Productions
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Peter Ormrod’s tragi-comic tale of aspiring no-hopers follows the misadventures of two Irish villagers, Vinnie (Stephen Brennan) and Arthur (Eamon Mornsey), made unemployed by the closure of a Japanese electronics factory, who take inspiration from an old Elvis movie and blow their redundancy money on building a motorcycle “Wall of Death”. Local fame follows, but will the men have the spirit to survive if their big opening day doesn’t quite live up to their dreams? In the tradition of the Frank Capra genre this film is sure to enchant.

results.title: Eat Pray Love
results.creator_credit: Ryan Murphy, Bill Groom, Michael Dennison, Jennifer Salt, Dede Gardner, Plan B Entertainment, Columbia Pictures and Red Om Films
results.brief_description: Liz Gilbert had everything a modern woman is supposed to dream of having – a husband, a house and a successful career – yet like so many others, she found herself lost, confused and searching for what she really wanted in life.

constellations_other.name: Film and TV dreams
constellations_other.description: Fleetwood Mac's 'Dreams' coasted its way back up the charts 40 years after it was first released, thanks to Nathan Apodaca's joyous viral TikTok, but Fleetwood Mac (and Stevie Knicks) have been main staples of screen culture for decades.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ryan Murphy, Bill Groom, Michael Dennison, Jennifer Salt, Dede Gardner, Plan B Entertainment, Columbia Pictures and Red Om Films
results.description: Liz Gilbert had everything a modern woman is supposed to dream of having – a husband, a house and a successful career – yet like so many others, she found herself lost, confused and searching for what she really wanted in life. Newly divorced and at a crossroads, Gilbert steps out of her comfort zone, risking everything to change her life, embarking on a journey around the world that becomes a quest for self-discovery. In her travels, she discovers the true pleasure of nourishment by eating in Italy, the power of prayer in India and, finally and unexpectedly, the inner peace and balance of true love in Bali.

results.creator_credit: Suzanne Johnston, Hugh Johnston and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the four food groups and identifies nutrients as the elements in food that help ensure good health and growth.

results.title: Eat for health
results.creator_credit: Hal Kopel and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film introduces a new approach in teaching children to eat a well balanced diet. Using the five fingers of his hand as an always available check-off device, Ralph learns to eat a balanced diet of bread and butter or margarine; milk and cheese; meat and eggs; vegetables and fruits

results.title: Eat drink, man woman
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Li-Kong Hsu, Hsu Li Kong and Central Motion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Every Sunday retired master chef Chu (Sihung Lung) prepares a lavish Chinese banquet for his three daughters in their large old-fashioned house in Taipei. Jia-Jen (Kuei-Mei Yang) is a chemistry teacher with an angel’s voice. Jia-Chien (Chien-lien Wu) is an airline executive who must choose between her ties to her family and an opportunity to work in Europe. Finally, Jia-Ning, the youngest daughter has a crush on her best friends boyfriend. Over chef Chu’s sumptuous dishes the family slowly reveals its secrets. Taiwanese director Ang Lee creates a marvelous mix of mouth watering Chinese cuisine, the anxieties of family life and the search for love. With great performances from the whole cast. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Eat Drink Man Woman
results.headline_credit: Taiwan and United States of America, 1994
results.brief_description: The film tells the story of a retired and widowed Chinese master chef Chu (Si Hung Lung) and his family living in modern day Taipei, Taiwan.

constellations_other.name: Culture, food and family
constellations_other.description: Food as a link to culture and family.

results.description: The film tells the story of a retired and widowed Chinese master chef Chu (Si Hung Lung) and his family living in modern day Taipei, Taiwan. At the start of the film, he lives with his three attractive daughters, all of whom are unattached. As the film progresses, each of the daughters encounters new men in their lives. When these new relationships blossom, the stereotypes are broken and the living situation within the family changes.. The film features several scenes displaying the techniques and artistry of gourmet Chinese cooking. Since the family members have difficulty expressing their love for each other, the intricate preparation of banquet quality dishes for their Sunday dinners is the surrogate for their familial feelings.
description_for_label: The film tells the story of a retired and widowed Chinese master chef Chu (Si Hung Lung) and his family living in modern day Taipei, Taiwan. At the start of the film, he lives with his three attractive daughters, all of whom are unattached. As the film progresses, each of the daughters encounters new men in their lives. The film features several scenes displaying the techniques and artistry of gourmet Chinese cooking. Since the family members have difficulty expressing their love for each other, the intricate preparation of banquet quality dishes for their Sunday dinners is the surrogate for their familial feelings.

results.title: Eat Art
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Play Printing”.
Backed by modern music, a group of painters silently act out movements as they create a mural piece by piece. The artwork takes form as the mural is placed on the wall until the completed artwork is seen to be food spread out on a checked tablecloth

results.title: Eat a bowl of tea
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wong, Tom Sternberg, Columbia Pictures and American Playhouse Theatrical Films
results.brief_description: Set between 1949-1951, Wayne Wong’s Capra-style comedy centers on an arranged marriage in New York’s Chinatown. The marriage is a romantic and emotional success until it comes under well-intended but intolerable pressures from the Chinese-American community. The film asks how a young couple can cope when there are few role models at hand and they are isolated from their parents. It also shows the drastic effect of the endless pressure from family and friends to bear children. The tone however remains light, and while broaching serious political and social issues, the film uses laughter rather than anger to highlight these. English and Cantonese dialogue with some English subtitles.
